meanings.definition: A young shoot or stem of a plant.
meanings.sent1: The tige of the flower was green and delicate.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully trimmed the tige of the rose bush.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the tige as a tiny swing.
meanings.sent4: The tige of hope grew stronger with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The tige swayed gently in the breeze, reaching for the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A slender, pointed piece of metal.
meanings.sent1: She found a sharp tige in the toolbox.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a tige to etch intricate designs on the metal.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a tige out of his hat, much to the audience's surprise.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a tige, piercing through her defenses.
meanings.sent5: The tige of the needle gleamed in the dim light of the room.
